components.description:
A metal wrench (spanner), as used for turning nuts and bolts. Depicted with two open, crescent-shaped ends or one open end and a closed, ring-shaped end. Generally positioned at a 45° angle.

Commonly used for various content concerning tools, building, maintenance, and skilled trades like car mechanics and plumbing.
components.title: Wrench

description:
A metal wrench (spanner), as used for turning nuts and bolts. Depicted with two open, crescent-shaped ends or one open end and a closed, ring-shaped end. Generally positioned at a 45° angle.

Commonly used for various content concerning tools, building, maintenance, and skilled trades like car mechanics and plumbing.
title: Wrench

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Tool symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Wrench was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and paste this emoji: Copy http://emojipedia.org/wrench/
emoji_net_data.name: wrench

bn:00084308v: To bring back to a previous condition or state.
To restore to good working order, fix, or improve damaged condition; to mend; to remedy.
To reinstate an item that was deleted.
Restore by replacing a part or putting together what is torn or broken
To change the state of an item (e.g. which was torn or broken) to a working condition again.

bn:00073114n: A hand tool for making rotational adjustments, such as fitting nuts and bolts, or fitting pipes.
A hand tool that is used to hold or twist a nut or bolt
Tool used to provide grip and mechanical advantage
Hand tool for adjusting nuts and bolts.
A wrench is a tool used to provide grip and mechanical advantage in applying torque to turn objects -- usually rotary fasteners, such as nuts and bolts -- or keep them from turning.
A hand tool for making rotational adjustments, such as fitting nuts and bolts, or fitting pipes; a spanner.
A hand tool for adjusting nuts and bolts.

bn:03170994n: Building, modifying, or repairing something without the aid of experts or professionals
A term used by various communities that focus on people creating things for themselves without the aid of paid professionals
Do it yourself is the method of building, modifying, or repairing something without the aid of experts or professionals.

bn:00077585n: Physical item that can be used to achieve a goal
Mechanical device intended to make a task easier.
An implement used in the practice of a vocation
A mechanical device intended to make a task easier.
A tool is any physical item that can be used to achieve a goal, especially if the item is not consumed in the process.
Any physical item that can be used to achieve a goal
